p: Plant description: Curcuma longa ( C. longa) Linn is a perennial herb belonging to the family Zingiberaceae. It is grown for commercial use in South and Southeast Asia. Curcumin, also known as turmeric, is obtained from the rhizome of the plant, and is commonly used in India as a food flavoring and coloring agent. Several preparations of the plant have been used for centuries in the Ayurvedic system of medicine [ 95].
